page.title: 02The village blacksmith.(2)
page.content: The village{blacksmith}endeavours to keep his prices reasonable and charges Â£14-Â£15 regardless of the size of horse. He realizes that if he became too expensive people would hesitate to own horses and his business would suffer. He earns a good living by working hard but feels 'brain more necessary than brawn'. His family have planted a chestnut tree for him to stand under but as yet it is only 3ft. high! There used to be 5{forges}in the village but now he is the only one. There has been a long history of the craft in this village. He gives {employment}to one {apprentice.}The apprenticeship lasts for 4 years but the apprentice's work is of such a high standard that the blacksmith has asked to become a partner in the business.
